stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) Honeybees play a vital role in agriculture. (2) They pollinate about one-third of the food we eat. (3) _________, their populations have been declining in recent years."

Which transition best begins sentence 3?
explanation: 'Unfortunately' signals a shift to a negative development (declining populations) after establishing their importance. It shows the contrast between their value and the troubling trend.
commonMistakes: A: the decline isn't similar to their role
C: the decline isn't additional positive info
D: the decline isn't an example of their role

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) The school fundraiser was a success. (2) We raised a lot of money. (3) The money will be used for new library books."

Which is the best revision of sentence 2?

options.label: A
options.text: We raised tons and tons of money.

options.label: B
options.text: We raised over $5,000 in just two weeks.

options.label: C
options.text: We raised some money for the school.

explanation: B adds specific details ($5,000, two weeks) that strengthen the writing. The other options are vague or wordy.
commonMistakes: D: passive voice and less engaging

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) Exercise improves cardiovascular health. (2) It strengthens muscles and bones. (3) _________, regular physical activity reduces stress and improves mood."

Which transition best fits?
explanation: 'Additionally' adds another benefit of exercise, continuing the pattern of listing positive effects.

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) The new park opened last Saturday. (2) People came. (3) There were games, food trucks, and live music."

Which revision of sentence 2 best improves the passage?

options.label: B
options.text: Hundreds of families from the neighborhood gathered to celebrate.

explanation: B adds specific, vivid detail (hundreds, families, neighborhood, celebrate) that strengthens the writing significantly.

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) First, preheat the oven to 350°F. (2) _________, mix the flour, sugar, and eggs in a bowl. (3) Then, pour the batter into a greased pan."

Which word best completes sentence 2?
explanation: 'Next' shows sequential order, fitting between 'First' (sentence 1) and 'Then' (sentence 3).
commonMistakes: A: 'Finally' implies this is the last step
C: no contrast in a recipe

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The Great Wall of China is one of the most impressive structures ever built. (2) It stretches over 13,000 miles. (3) My cousin visited China last year. (4) Construction began over 2,000 years ago during the Qin Dynasty."

Which sentence should be removed to improve the focus of the passage?
explanation: Sentence 3 is off-topic. The passage is about the Great Wall, and a cousin's trip doesn't support the main idea.
commonMistakes: B: supports the main idea with a fact

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) The city council voted to build a new community center. (2) They did this because the old one was falling apart and nobody wanted to go there anymore because it was in bad shape. (3) Construction will begin in March."

Which is the best revision of sentence 2?

options.label: A
options.text: They did this because the old one was bad.

options.label: B
options.text: The decision was prompted by the deteriorating condition of the existing facility, which had seen a sharp decline in attendance.

options.label: C
options.text: They built it because the old building was falling apart and nobody liked it.

options.label: D
options.text: The old one was in bad shape so they wanted a new one.

explanation: B eliminates redundancy and uses precise, formal language appropriate for informational writing.

stem:
Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) Many schools have adopted later start times for teenagers. (2) Research shows that teens' biological clocks make it hard for them to fall asleep before 11 PM. (3) _________, starting school at 7:30 AM means many students are sleep-deprived. (4) Schools that shifted to 8:30 AM starts saw improved attendance and grades."

Which transition best begins sentence 3?
explanation: 'Consequently' shows the cause-effect relationship: teens can't sleep early (cause) → 7:30 AM starts cause sleep deprivation (effect).
commonMistakes: A: this is a consequence, not additional info
C: no contrast between sentences 2 and 3
D: sentence 3 isn't an example of sentence 2

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) Dogs make wonderful pets. (2) They are loyal and loving. (3) Dogs need regular exercise. (4) They also provide companionship for people who live alone."

Which sentence would work best AFTER sentence 2?

options.label: B
options.text: For example, many dogs greet their owners enthusiastically every day.

options.label: D
options.text: The first dogs were domesticated thousands of years ago.

explanation: Sentence B provides a specific example of dogs being 'loyal and loving,' directly supporting sentence 2.
commonMistakes: D: changes the subject to history

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) There are several reasons to recycle. (2) _________, recycling reduces the amount of waste in landfills. (3) Second, it conserves natural resources. (4) Third, it saves energy."

Which word best begins sentence 2?
explanation: 'First' begins the enumeration announced in sentence 1 ('several reasons'), matching 'Second' and 'Third.'
commonMistakes: A: there are more reasons after

Read this passage:

"(1) The experiment required careful preparation. (2) We got all the stuff we needed. (3) Each measurement was recorded three times for accuracy."

Which is the best revision of sentence 2?

options.label: B
options.text: We assembled the necessary equipment, including beakers, thermometers, and safety goggles.

explanation: B replaces vague 'stuff' with specific equipment names and uses the precise verb 'assembled.'

Read this passage excerpt:

"(1) Some people argue that homework helps students practice skills. (2) _________, others believe homework causes unnecessary stress without improving learning."

Which transition best begins sentence 2?
explanation: 'On the other hand' introduces an opposing viewpoint, which is exactly what sentence 2 presents.
commonMistakes: A: the views are opposite, not similar

"(1) The Industrial Revolution transformed society. (2) Factories replaced small workshops. (3) Cities grew rapidly as workers moved from rural areas. (4) My grandmother loves knitting. (5) Working conditions were often dangerous, with long hours and low pay."

explanation: Sentence 4 about knitting is completely irrelevant to the Industrial Revolution topic.

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) Climate change is a pressing global issue. (2) Rising temperatures are causing ice caps to melt. (3) It is very bad and everyone should be worried about it. (4) Scientists predict sea levels could rise by several feet by 2100."

Which is the best revision of sentence 3?

options.label: B
options.text: This is concerning for people everywhere.

options.label: C
options.text: These changes threaten coastal communities, disrupt ecosystems, and intensify extreme weather events.

options.label: D
options.text: Everyone should worry because it's super bad.

explanation: C replaces the vague, informal sentence with specific consequences of climate change, strengthening the argument.
commonMistakes: B: slightly better but still lacks specifics

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The school should adopt a uniform policy for several important reasons. (2) Uniforms reduce peer pressure related to clothing. (3) They save families money on school clothes. (4) _________, uniforms create a sense of school identity and community."

Which transition best begins sentence 4?
explanation: 'Finally' signals the last reason in the series, providing a concluding point to the list of benefits.

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) Water is essential for life. (2) Humans need water to survive. (3) Water covers about 71% of Earth's surface. (4) We should all drink enough water every day."

Which sentence is the best topic sentence for this paragraph?
explanation: Sentence 1 is the broadest statement that the other sentences support. It's the best topic sentence.
commonMistakes: D: recommendation, not a topic sentence

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The field trip to the museum was educational. (2) We learned about ancient civilizations. (3) _________, we got to see real artifacts from Egypt."

Which transition best begins sentence 3?
explanation: 'In particular' introduces a specific detail about what they learned, narrowing from the general statement in sentence 2.

stem:
Read this sentence from a passage:

"The roller coaster was fun."

Which revision adds sensory detail?

options.label: A
options.text: The roller coaster was really fun.

options.label: C
options.text: The roller coaster roared down the track as wind whipped through our hair and our stomachs dropped.

options.label: D
options.text: The roller coaster was a good ride.

explanation: C uses sensory details (sound: roared, touch: wind whipped, feeling: stomachs dropped) to create a vivid experience.
commonMistakes: B: synonym for 'fun' with no sensory detail

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The invention of the printing press changed the world. (2) Before the printing press, books were copied by hand, making them rare and expensive. (3) _________, after Gutenberg's invention, books could be produced quickly and cheaply."

Which transition best begins sentence 3?
explanation: 'In contrast' highlights the difference between before (rare, expensive) and after (quickly, cheaply) the printing press.
commonMistakes: A: the situations are opposite, not similar
C: not just adding info — showing change
D: not a direct result of sentence 2

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) Volunteering benefits both communities and individuals. (2) Community gardens, for example, bring neighbors together. (3) Volunteers also report feeling happier and more connected. (4) Some people don't volunteer because they're busy. (5) Studies show that even a few hours of volunteering per month can make a difference."

Where should sentence 5 be moved for better organization?

options.label: D
options.text: It should stay where it is.

explanation: Sentence 5 addresses the concern raised in sentence 4 (being too busy) by saying even a few hours helps. It logically follows as a counterargument.
commonMistakes: B: doesn't connect to sentence 3 as well
D: better flow if moved after sentence 4

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The school's recycling program has been remarkably successful. (2) Paper waste has decreased by 40% since the program began. (3) Plastic bottle recycling has tripled. (4) _________, the school has saved over $2,000 in waste disposal costs."

Which transition best begins sentence 4?
explanation: 'Moreover' adds an additional benefit (cost savings) to the list of successes already mentioned.

stem:
Read this passage:

"(1) The Amazon rainforest is often called the 'lungs of the Earth.' (2) It is very big and has many trees. (3) It produces approximately 20% of the world's oxygen."

Which is the best revision of sentence 2?

options.label: A
options.text: It's really big with lots of trees.

options.label: B
options.text: Spanning over 2.1 million square miles, the Amazon contains an estimated 390 billion individual trees.

options.label: C
options.text: The Amazon has trees and is large.

options.label: D
options.text: There are many trees there and it is big.

explanation: B replaces vague descriptions with precise data (2.1 million sq miles, 390 billion trees), strengthening the informational writing.

stem:
A student is writing a persuasive essay about extending recess. Which sentence would best serve as a concluding statement?

"(1) In conclusion, longer recess periods would benefit students. (2) Studies prove that breaks improve focus. (3) My friend says recess is her favorite part of the day. (4) Therefore, schools should consider increasing recess by at least 15 minutes."
explanation: Sentence 4 makes a specific call to action ('should consider increasing recess by at least 15 minutes'), which is the strongest concluding statement for a persuasive essay.

Read this passage:

"(1) The debate over school start times continues across the country. (2) _________, a school district in California pushed its start time from 7:30 to 8:30 AM. (3) The results were striking: attendance improved by 8%, and average GPAs rose."

Which transition best begins sentence 2?
explanation: 'In one notable case' introduces a specific example of the broader trend described in sentence 1.
commonMistakes: C: sentence 2 isn't a conclusion from sentence 1
D: it's not comparing two similar things
